page.content: ...Butler to reconstruct it. The building work had to be carried out entirely with half bricks, many cut by hand to fit in the dome and Butlers had to search over a wide area for suitable hand-made grey burnt bricks, made, like the originals, in some of the many local kilns that have long since disappeared. Local people have expressed their delight at the way the work has been done.The rebuilding work,which has also involved repairing the iron gate which gives access to the spring water-once the areas only source-has not cost the ratepayers anything.The bill is going to the insurance company providing cover for the vehicle which caused the damage.
